meanings.definition: excessively particular or fastidious in taste or standards
meanings.sent1: She is so finickier about her food choices that she only eats organic vegetables.
meanings.sent2: His finickier nature makes it challenging to find a restaurant that meets his standards.
meanings.sent3: The finickier cat refused to eat any food that wasn't served in its favorite bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her finickier taste buds could detect even the slightest hint of bitterness in the coffee.
meanings.sent5: The finickier customer meticulously inspected each item on the menu before ordering.

meanings.definition: showing or requiring great attention to detail
meanings.sent1: The artist's finickier brush strokes added depth and texture to the painting.
meanings.sent2: The finickier instructions highlighted the specific measurements needed for the project.
meanings.sent3: His finickier approach to organizing his desk involved color-coding every item.
meanings.sent4: The finickier detective noticed the tiny footprint that led to solving the case.
meanings.sent5: The finickier editor meticulously reviewed each sentence for grammatical errors.

meanings.definition: characterized by excessive delicacy or refinement
meanings.sent1: The finickier china set was reserved for special occasions due to its fragility.
meanings.sent2: Her finickier taste in art led her to collect only rare and exquisite pieces.
meanings.sent3: The finickier lace curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent4: The finickier music connoisseur could distinguish between various symphony orchestras.
meanings.sent5: The finickier fashion designer insisted on using only the finest silk for her creations.
